OHIO STATE UNIVERSITY
TO MEMBERS
of
THE ASSOCIATION OF COLLEGE AND UNIVERSITY BROADCASTING STATIONS
(and educational officials cooperating with the Association)
The Associated Press reported from Washington on the afternoon of Feb¬
ruary 3 that President Hoover last Friday named Professor J. C. Jensen
of Nebraska Wesleyan University to be a member of the Federal Radio Com¬
mission. The Association of College and University Broadcasting Stations
has been working on this project for several months. We have now completed
the first major step—the naming on the part of the President of Professor
densen to the Commission. It is needless to state that it will be very
difficult to get Senate action on confirming appointments at the present
time.
Officials of the Association urge your immediate action in behalf of Pro¬
fessor Jensen. Kindly wire your Senators, even though they have already
endorsed Professor Jensen, to confirm his appointment. Due to limited
time and change in the Administration in the course of the next few days
it is necessary that this action be followed immediately.
Officers of the Association desire that all members of our group have
wires on the Senators’desk* not later than Monday, February 13. It is
imperative that w act now. The hard part of the battle has been won,
but there is still much to do. Act t*d<ay in the interest of educational
broadcasting!
Sincerely yours,
Jos. F. Wright, President.
(Signature authorized by wire)
Bulletin released by T, M, Beaird,
